snippet: Less than a week after a meeting to discuss stemming the flow of people toward Germany, thousands were stuck in Greece after the Macedonian authorities sealed the border.
abstract: Police on Macedonia's border clash violently with desperate migrants stalled by tighter border controls;  in absence of unified policy European countries increasingly respond to crisis unilaterally, stranding thousands in Greece, which is outraged at being continent's de facto refugee holding center.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and DIMITRIS BOUNIAS
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Less than a week after a meeting to discuss stemming the flow of people toward Germany, thousands were stuck in Greece after the Macedonian authorities sealed the border.

headline.main: Violence Erupts in Greece as Migrants Try to Cross Into Macedonia
headline.print_headline: Violence Erupts in Greece as Migrants Try to Cross Into Macedonia

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
